info.game_comments: Clues 6 & 9 from the Jeopardy! Round were shown in the 2015-03-02 episode of Better Call Saul.

(1, 1).clue: The first word in I Chronicles is this man first mentioned in Genesis 2:19

(2, 1).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew stands between two trees, holding binoculars, wearing khaki and a pith helmet.)  It's the style of clothes I'm wearing or the type of expedition I'm gearing up for

(3, 1).clue: Submarines have fixed tubes in the bow to shoot these underwater weapons

(4, 1).clue: The first movie with a plot was filmed in 1903 & concerned the "great" robbery of one of these

(5, 1).clue: This company introduced its Trac II twin-blade razor in 1971 & the good news disposable razor 5 years later

(6, 1).clue: Tyrone Willingham is the first African-American football coach to lead this school's Fighting Irish

(1, 2).clue: In Exodus the Lord told Moses to make a laver of brass for Aaron & his sons to wash their hands & these in

(2, 2).clue: Better have a breath mint after eating this Italian-named dish of shrimp sauteed in garlic & butter

(3, 2).clue: If a surfer rides the tube in London, he's on this

(4, 2).clue: City that was home to the USA's first boat club & organized baseball team, both named Knickerbocker

(5, 2).clue: Originally, this bread built strong bodies 8 ways; later the count went up to 12

(6, 2).clue: To this longtime Packers coach, winning wasn't everything; it was the only thing!

(1, 3).clue: Upright man who moaned, "Naked came I out of my mother's womb and naked shall I return thither"

(2, 3).clue: Stephen S. Wise was a well-known one; Isaac Bashevis Singer was the son of one

(3, 3).clue: Every little breeze seems to whisper the name of this first test tube baby

(5, 3).clue: In 1984 this TV ratings service was acquired by Dun & Bradstreet

(6, 3).clue: He was NBA coach of the year 3 times in the 1990s with the Lakers, Knicks & Miami Heat

(1, 4).clue: I Kings uses "slept with his fathers" as a euphemism for this

(2, 4).clue: Don't be shy now;they're the colorfulpond fish seen here

(3, 4).clue: The gas-filled Geissler tube of the late 1850s was adapted for use in these advertising signs

(4, 4).clue: It's been "cataloged" as the first skyscraper over 1,400 feet in height

(5, 4).clue: Henry Wells & William Fargo co-founded this company known for its credit card; "Don't leave home without it"

(6, 4).clue: The all-time winningest NHL coach in regular season & playoffs, he's coached the Detroit Red Wings since 1993

(1, 5).clue: Saul wanted to give his eldest daughter Merab to this future king, but Michal, another daughter, loved him

(2, 5).clue: Drumroll please... it's another name for a set of kettledrums

(3, 5).clue: Like you, a frog has this tube connecting the middle ear & the throat

(4, 5).clue: In 1891 Samuel O'Reilly turned Edison's electric engraving pen into the first electric machine to make these, sailor

(5, 5).clue: In 1946 this brand came in as the first laundry detergent to have a phosphate compound as a water softener

(6, 5).clue: He's one of the few men to win a Super Bowl as a player, as assistant coach & as head coach of the Bears in 1986

(1, 1).clue: Crockett represented this state for 3 terms in the U.S. Congress

(2, 1).clue: In 2001 she denied reports of a $20 million offer to reprise her role as Ripley for "Alien 5"

(3, 1).clue: Robert Yerkes developed 2 intelligence tests: the Alpha exam for the literate & this one for the not

(4, 1).clue: Robert Louis Stevenson drew a map with his 12-year-old stepson that inspired him to write this story

(5, 1).clue: Nebraska Wesleyan: in this state capital

(6, 1).clue: Raisins & currants are traditional ingredients in this sometimes re-gifted Christmas treat

(1, 2).clue: In 1818 Crockett was elected to this rank in the Fifty-seventh Militia Regiment in Lawrence County

(2, 2).clue: Born in NYC in 1955, this Oscar winner has played a thief, a nun, a psychic & an intergalactic bartender

(3, 2).clue: Since 1992 Alpha Oumar Konare has been president of this African country whose name is an anagram of "mail"

(4, 2).clue: This title character releases 2 jinns: The Slave of the Ring & The Slave of the Lamp

(5, 2).clue: Where the peachtrees grow: Georgia State

(6, 2).clue: It's another name for a hydrant; a stocky person is said to be built like one

(2, 5).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew reports from Washington, D.C.) In "The Exorcist", Jason Miller as this priest falls down the steps here, now known as "The Exorcist Steps"

(0, 0).clue: He was the last president to take the oath of office from someone other than the Chief Justice of the U.S.
